comments.content:
I've got two beauties in front of me at the moment that I would like to purchase. The first is also from Fountain.   
   
Eric Sans   
 [http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ericsans.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052656/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ericsans.asp)   
   
The second is Miles Newlyn's beautiful blackletter, Ferox   
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000020](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052656/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000020)

Eric Sans was given last year by veer for free on registering. Got my copy there :P.   
   
I've tried to use several times, but it's usage is quite limited due to the extra thin body. There was an ID on typophile that managed to use it quite well!

I was also thinking purchasing FSD's CP Company, but the gorgeous [Katarine](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052656/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=katarine) goes first

I'm printing out the [Fountain Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052656/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ftn_farao.asp)PDF and salivating on it right now. I also will probably get their Mayo at some point in the future.   
   
Also, I saw [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052656/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=NEUTRAFACE-FO&sub=inuse)for the first time recently and am a bit infatuated with it as well.
dan, eric sans is available on the cd accompanying the first indy fonts book.
